{{Infobox person | name = Dennis Cheng | birth_place = | birth_date = | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = | spouse = | children = | parents = | relatives = | alma_mater = [[Swarthmore College]]
[[London School of Economics]] | religion = }} '''Dennis Cheng''' is an American development executive. He served as the chief development officer of the [[Clinton Foundation]] from 2011 to 2015. He serves as the national finance director of the [[Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2016|2016 presidential campaign of Hillary Clinton]]. ==Education== Cheng graduated with a bachelor of arts degree in political science and economics from [[Swarthmore College]] in 2001.{{cite web|title=Biography: OFFICE OF THE CHIEF OF PROTOCOL: Mr. Dennis Cheng|url=http://www.state.gov/s/cpr/137476.htm|website=United States Department of State|accessdate=September 6, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Alumni Weekend 2011 Registrations|url=http://swarthmore71.org/reglist.html|website=Swarthmore Class of 1971}} He received an MSc from the [[London School of Economics]] (LSE). ==Career== Cheng served as the Deputy Chief of Protocol of the United States from July 20, 2009 to July 2011. Cheng has since 2008 acted in important roles for Hillary Clinton. He served as New York state finance director for the 2008 Hillary Clinton presidential campaign. During the Clinton-led [[State Department]] he was deputy chief of protocol. He joined the [[Clinton Foundation]] in 2011 as chief development officer in 2011 and is credited with raising $248 million until 2015. In 2015, Cheng became the national finance director of Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign. His role in the campaign is to direct fundraising activity and serve as a close aide to [[Hillary Clinton]] with major donors describing Cheng's presence as "often as close as you get to talking to Hillary Clinton".{{cite news|title=Top aide leaving foundation to build Clinton's 2016 fundraising team|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/02/09/politics/dennis-cheng-clinton-foundation-2016/index.html|publisher=CNN|date=February 9, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Hillary Clinton’s $2 Billion Money Man|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2015/08/06/hillary-clinton-s-2-billion-money-man.html|agency=Daily Beast|date=August 6, 2015}} Cheng spent the summer of 2016 taking Clinton from fundraiser to fundraiser in the richest zipcodes across the United States, including [[Beverly Hills, California]], the [[Silicon Valley]], [[Cape Cod]] and [[The Hamptons]].{{cite news|last1=Chozick|first1=Amy|last2=Martin|first2=Jonathan|title=Where Has Hillary Clinton Been? Ask the Ultrarich|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/04/us/politics/hillary-clinton-fundraising.html?_r=0|accessdate=September 5, 2016|work=The New York Times|date=September 3, 2016|quote=The campaign’s finance team is led by Dennis Cheng, previously the chief fund-raiser for the Clinton Foundation, and it employs a couple dozen staff members. Mr. Cheng, who attends the events with Mrs. Clinton, offers donors a number of contribution options that provide them and their families varying levels of access to Mrs. Clinton.}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cheng, Dennis}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Swarthmore College alumni]] [[Category:Alumni of the London School of Economics]] [[Category:American political consultants]] [[Category:Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2016]] [[Category:Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2008]] [[Category:People associated with the United States presidential election, 2008]] [[Category:People associated with the United States presidential election, 2016]]
